bow: has anyone experienced feeling of impending death after having baby hi ladies did know who to turn for this but it been on my mind so much and do know what to make of it or how to control it anymore just some background my grandmother died when was and it really affected me was confused and scared and got sick for months my mother died of cancer years ago had baby 12 months ago just have this feeling that am going to die or that am not going to be here for very long as it gets closer and closer to what do know it seems to affect me more and more last night started crying because felt like my time is coming up ve had this urgency to tell people how truly feel about them it comes and it goes sometimes feel it but then the next it feels like it not true and should just enjoy life have come to the point where do know what to trust is this instinct trying to tell me something is this paranoia is this because now appreciate life and have something to live for is this how alexander hamilton felt where he knew he was going to die but did know when what if it like harry houdini where have spent my whole life wanting to know about death how people know they re going to die how people cope with knowing they re going to die that when get my own insight do trust it and end up dieing without doing anything wanted to do or maybe do know am going to die at some point hopefully when am older and this is just that realization and now the contemplation of how to make the most of my life has anyone ever experienced this feeling before well guess if you did you be dead but it always on my mind and freaks me out still bumper but this sounds like panic attack to me have had them for years but have done lot better job of coping and recognizing them just skimmed this link http www anxietycoach com overcoming panic attacks html did read all of it and it seems to have some good advice for handling panic attack as it happens good luck and know that you re *absolutely* not alone in feeling this way thoughts like these after having baby are common even though people do often talk about it what you re describing could be form of postpartum anxiety partially due to your background and partially attributable to postpartum hormones it real it temporary and it treatable if you would like to discuss your concerns with compassionate trained volunteer who can refer you to local resources please contact postpartum support international if you are in the us the helpline number is 800 944 4ppd if you live somewhere else here link to support listings in other countries http www postpartum net get help locations international please keep in mind that the number gave you is warmline not hotline you ll likely have to leave message and someone will call you back within 24 hours agree that it sounds like you may have postpartum anxiety whether or not that the case it sounds like something that therapist could help with sometimes talking to someone can help so much and they can help figure out if this is ppa awww thank you this makes me feel better wow thank you so much for the support truly appreciate it thank you so much it makes me feel better to know that this is common and not truly instinct that might day soon yes it was absolutely terrifying agree with everyone else was diagnosed with post partum depression it got better with medication and therapy but those feelings were the worst ve ever felt oh wow thank you for sharing are you over it now how long did it take how long ago was this obviously you re not dead now so go you remember laying next to my son for nap time when he was about three months old and having my first real panic attack all could think about was what if just had aneurysm or something who would take care of him what if fell asleep and did wake up freaked out but apparently it super common with new moms really that makes me feel better not that you went through that but that it common hope it goes away and that do die no problem my baby is three months old now and while still have some symptoms of depression they re mild feeling weepy lack of energy etc the first two weeks post partum were the absolute worst for me was in the hospital for that time because got home with my baby and had such strong feelings that was going to die went back to the er just kept telling myself if could make it to six weeks pp it would get better no idea why picked that time to focus on but it gave me something to work towards went home after two weeks and it was better but still tough would say the worst feelings passed after two weeks and then by six weeks was just sort of sad and now at months pp feel much better was on antidepressants my whole pregnancy but they upped them two days pp and was also on an anxiolytic ativan and ambien for those first two weeks would have made it without my wonderful doctor and my husband good luck it absolutely gets better but know how hopeless it feels when you re experiencing those feelings went through this in my mid 30s so felt old guess really should have thought that ve had about dozen people around me die from suicide type deaths due to feeling abandoned alienated or some mental disorder it was hard after birth because we had just moved to rural town 2000 miles from our friends and family and was feeling alien felt old my body hurt it looked floppy was tired no one would talk to me for days weeks at time there was this new little girl laying there her skin was beautiful and her back was straight she could learn whatever she wanted to without hardly trying and she looked like me but younger was jealous of her youth and of all the time life she had to live yet but mostly was scared because felt so helpless and small felt about as strong as she did knew no one could call for help what if just exhausted myself one day what if lay down for nap with my daughter and she woke up but did this went on some days would stare at her for hours planning some way to have someone around when needed them my husband worked in remote area could never get hold of him wish could make friends but felt injured and could join club or do friendly things daydreamed about going back in time it took me about year to get over it did take meds and did go to doctor worked it out knew it was depression because have been diagnosed with depression before meds never helped me so just tried to become healthier lost weight started working out ate better feel little more confident wo just drop dead and it made me feel happier agree with the other people that say it common ve experienced it to much smaller degree and it really is hard because the reality is we all die sometimes suddenly what helped me feel better was when finally went to dr for another issue and had full detailed physical and blood panel that all came back great maybe try going to the dr and getting full work up it may put your mind more at ease as well as getting the chance to mention the anxiety to the dr seven years later still kicking went and got checkup made sure was dying and that my heart was not in danger of just stopping to beat and my dr prescribed cymbalta which helped tremendously felt this way after had my second baby laid awake every night thinking that could go any day in any way would sob thinking of how she would understand what happened or why she was being nursed anymore but she would most certainly feel void where she could no longer smell me or hear my voice too was diagnosed with postpartum depression thank you so much for sharing it is such an awful feeling and am trying so hard not to let it get to me am so glad you over came it to help people like me baby is 12 months and am still struggling with these thoughts am not sick or unhealthy but it feels like it could happen any time this is terrible whoa thank you so much for sharing love hearing that you overcame this without meds that what am trying to do as have focused more on myself eating better dressing better and putting on some makeup have felt better but then come back to the what ifs just want to spend the rest of my life with my daughter and see her enjoy her life it would make me really sad if could be there to see her grow up or our time was shadowed by illness do know why think so much just wanted to feel normal like not going to die great suggestion am pretty healthy so it would help to see that in numbers and then use it as new starting point awwww lol good for you should do that am just riddled with anxiety never thought would go through this awwww that terrible why must we go through this just want to enjoy life ugh honestly if you have insurance getting clean bill of health and the reassurance that am healthy human being was way worth the embarrssment of admitting my anxiety to my dr it helped knowing that it happens to other new parents mean not to sound like kids are everything but what other reason have we really had to fear death before having little person to take care of all the sudden its like holy crap cant die for at least 18 years felt this way before had kid was for sure never make it past my mid twenties all my teen years thought go above and beyond to make friends and do something that would last because felt be dead by 21 either in car accident or some random event that led to my death every year closer to twenty tried less and less and got so depressed and anxious would leave my room except to use the bathroom eat go to work was diagnosed with depression and took weeks worth if meds pulled my head up and got into school met my future husband and eventually 21 came and went do get the feeling of eminent death anymore ve had pregnancy dreams about dying when my son was born and my husband having to deal with everything as single dad think everyone has couple of those what ifs from time to time but if it getting worse and you ca shake that feeling then seek help it okay to feel life is fleeting but it should invade us so totally it preoccupies our day to day life hang in there always thought was the only one with that feeling glad to know not super weird hopefully it ll pass if not there are ways to help cope think it pretty common after you have baby to have intrusive thoughts like this but it sounds to me like the degree to which you have them is more than normal it sounds like other commenters have already linked you up with some good resources but do think that having them is normal to an extent every mom ve talked to has acknowledged having something similar you ll be walking down the stairs and suddenly imagine what would happen if you dropped the baby or randomly ll wonder what would happen if die while my husband is deployed how long would it take for someone to notice that dead and come rescue my kids for me it was more frequent when my baby was young sure it partly hormonal and partly just the truth of daunting reality know that my baby relies on me for her survival once she started drinking from cup and eating some food some of that pressure goes away because know she would at least be able to be fed by stranger should something happen to me also think it sort of your brain way of prepping you to be aware of environmental dangers anyway the difference seems to be that have these thoughts think about them for moment or two maybe prepare what if solution for the problem and then move on with my day my friend on the other hand was having trouble letting go of these worries she knew they were kind of bizarre and very unlikely to actually happen but it was affecting her overall mood for the day and was keeping her awake at night she went to her doctor and then consulted with mental health professional and started medication for her anxiety she pretty quickly felt happier and no longer dwelled on the negative thoughts so if it interferes with your life on regular basis which it seems like it does and you want it to stop would definitely consult with someone about it but personally still have moments of overwhelming emotion and do mind them life *is* short and appreciate the reminder from time to time have four month old and have been feeling this way oh my goodness did realize how bad it was until read your post and saw the replies constantly think going to die and actually spend lot of time thinking about writing my husband kids letter for after dead no one in my life has died though it has gotten better recently but for while there was just totally convinced that was going to die at any point think going to have to talk to my doctor about it after reading the comments here pretty sure it not normal thank you for posting op yes had it and went on zoloft safe for breastfeeding if that applies and was so much better afterward was on it for year and then weaned off and then got 10 ativan pills to take just in case ve taken in the past 10 months so still get those thoughts but super rarely also am terrified of addiction so try to cope on my own before resort to taking meds therapy did nothing for me it was truly messed up hormones that could really only be fixed with time had morbid thoughts and also lost my mother few years before having my child my gp said it was totally normal however if it affects your daily life like you avoid going out because you re worried about car accident that kind of thing then counselling is wise you may also get resurgence of the grief at losing your mother and this continues as your child grows and it yet another milestone the late grandparent will never see it very very hard still happens to me 10 years after birthing kiddo it rare but when it hits it hits hard in my psych training we talked about ppd and intrusive thoughts it helps ton now to remember that my brain is just having moment try not to judge my thoughts and just let them be the death related panic attacks last only minutes now if you have time maybe do some reading on intrusive thoughts and mindfulness the combo might help know this is exactly the same but before had my baby was total adrenaline junkie roller coasters street racing motorcycles sky diving whatever gives me that life threatening rush after having baby suddenly even 25mph in school zone was pretty scary for me parking lots even if they have speed bumps just driving in general was almost certain we were just all going to die and not by my own recklessness but because of the unpredictability of another driver in separate vehicle ramming into me potentially heh it strange control issue still working on guess my point is do think what you are feeling is unusual or abnormal doing the exact same thing right now the change is great and should be weaned off the drugs by late spring feel like much happier mom now had it to certain extent but also worried that my daughter would die before she was five was depressed and didi have ppd was otherwise perfectly normal did tell my husband because knew my fears were irrational had her at 40 so the feelings of mortality get are particularly strong every now and then reminded that when she 20 ll be 60 and it scares me that might not live to see her become an adult most of the time though fine but that fear is always at the back of my mind and honestly think it pretty normal my mom was pregnant with my sister which was very difficult pregnancy considering she had surgery to remove the appendix at the 3rd month we were living in seismic zone so the risk of an earthquake was *there* all the time and shortly after giving birth emergency section her mother was diagnosed with cancer she would wake up in the middle of the night almost every night thinking she was dying and crying until she saw professional and she diagnosed her with general anxiety every night since 20 now when trying to sleep remember going to die someday and get anxiety attacks and especially now that my son is almost two months do go through this alone try to get help and you ll get over this wish you the best of lucks have similar months pp but mine is attributable to how sick was during pregnancy and still am now had multiple pulmonary embolisms and was so scared that the baby and would die and leave my poor husband all alone it has been really tough time but still here and the anxiety is getting less do think it will ever go away completely as it like living with ticking timebomb did go to therapy which helped immensely still have fears of suddenly dying collapsing and baby being harmed because of it if walking dog alone with baby no one would know where was but trying really hard to not let it stop me doing things speak to your doctor they can help good luck new dad here that browses this subreddit too have heightened sense of my own mortality since my son was born two months ago regularly feel anxious about the possibility that may not be around whole lot longer have really discussed it with my so or anyone else hoping will just come to accept it and not feel so anxious hey just letting you know had post partum psychosis and overcame it without drugs you can do it it sounds like you have some paranoia that you re not yet 100 sure you do believe it hard sometimes still think my delusions miiight be true which is depressing just live functional life and your track record itself will be your comfort yep my son is three and am still anxious about me and or my husband dying my best friend started getting serious anxiety even while she was still pregnant her doctor explained that it was normal reaction to such large responsibility and suspect in your case it past experience creeping in as well agree with the other posters and recommend you contact counselor to talk through your thoughts and see if they can provide any additional help thank you for posting this would give you gold if were so cheap this has been my post partum theme it doesnt affect my daily life but do think about how someday am going to take my last breath often think about it at bedtime and then have to try my best to shake it off to top it all off the medication take to keep me healthy also increases my cancer risk if think about it too much feel panicked dont want to fucking die do know if had feeling of impending death so much as worry about what would happen if died think to certain extend those thoughts are normal because it the first time you ve had someone entire existence dependent on your survival at least for me my kids were both breastfed and would take bottle could leave the house for more than an hour at time without them because they needed me it was sinking feeling sometimes thinking what would happen if died those thoughts are kind of normal as long as they re fleeting and do disrupt your life if you re dealing with anxiety over the thoughts and feel overwhelmed in anyway then you should look into talking to someone ve just been diagnosed with postpartum anxiety my doctor prescribed me mild anti anxiety medication though have started taking it yet and am unsure if will though just going and acknowledging that that what experiencing actually helped lot on its own ve been terrified of bad stuff happening to my baby my husband or my marriage and how survive after know that what thinking is irrational and with practice getting better at just redirecting my thoughts and telling myself how thankful am that things *are going well* as sort of an internal mantra the more practice it the easier it getting and there shorter the negative thoughts seem to linger definitely talk to your doctor it so common after started talking about it my sister said she had been experiencing the same thing since her daughter was born years ago there definitely no real timeline for this sort of thing think it is normal did have ppd or anything but having kid brought on my sense of mortality like nothing else still get hit with waves of panic now remember reading something about the sun life span soon after she was born and while knew that fact before for some reason now it gutted me and was completely distraught that life as we know it had definite timeline it just comes in waves now but was obsessed with that fact and the idea of my own death for awhile am lot more careful now about going to the doctor for preventative or early on where before used to wait until had fever of 104f or something really bad before would bother it just feels so heavy now sometimes that someone really needs me oh wow thanks so much for the support yes am in the process of writing things down am just so worried ca be there for them it terrible just want to not think about it good for you am trying to do it without meds and luckily it does happen often but often enough that it scares me and makes me think it really going to happen ohh good do think am there yet but do get scared glad to hear it pretty common really love this thank you am very interested in psychology so maybe studying this will really help me wow this is great to hear so it is possible to go from one thing to another after having baby had these feelings when was sick and ve been pretty good about keeping them at bay but when had baby they came up ten fold am glad to know that it just something with the mind that happens after giving life almost like an appreciation for life which is actually good thing hope it does psychology always interested me as well so decided to get degree in it if you do end up seeing counselor be blunt with them the one saw for ppd completely ignored the fact that had just given birth weeks earlier and tried to diagnose me as borderline he wanted to put me an antipsychotics and lithium while was trying to breastfeed some psychs can be crazier than their patients awwww that would intensify this so much more just remember that 60 is the new 30 atleast that why my 60 year old parents say and they are spry thank you so much for sharing is your mother still alive at least she was vocal about her fears my mother never talked about it which is why have so many questions awwww these thoughts suck good thing you got help because it seems like everyone who has had it has overcome it in other words did die of course we ca take into account the dead people but am sure it less so it not just us women thanks for sharing it must be natural thing in regards to appreciating life and now wanting to be here when was young did really care or think about it now think about it all the time good point yes am bit paranoid thank you everyone including you has been so helpful am so glad not alone ugh that the worst before bed when you fear you wo wake up just think about how am going to die will suffer what will that feel like will know is this cramp ovarian cancer should get it checked am dieing going to die that how it progresses lol know what you mean always think about what would happen luckily have come to turns with who would take care of her but want to do it good for you do the same thing where am all about prevention now want to live until am 100 and would think it was really unfair for someone to take my life or if died in an accident the thing think about the most is someone taking my life there is nothing you can do in that situation and that what scares me really how long did it take to get back into school was it expensive have been thinking about getting degree in psychology but have full time job and kids and quitting work is not on the horizon waited till kiddo was in kindergarten to go back honestly extremely lucky as had family member offer to pay my whole way through school found job at the county mental health dept that allows me to set my own schedule so can work when kiddo is in school and can miss during class times it taking forever since can really only afford to take two classes term but nearly done with my ba kiddo is nine and the only time she complains is when have to take night classes she used to me being home with her 24 single mom so she relies on me more than anything keeping routine has been my lifesaver if did have daily routine built in if lose my mind which is fine tried to too do forget though that it is chemical serotonin problem and you ca will it away with the power of positive thinking any more than diabetic can will away an insulin imbalance diet and exercise can sometimes control it but sometimes ca experienced this after my fourth child it was really severe postpartum anxiety and did want to be treated because the self preserving nature of the illness meant that believed that was thinking very clearly and everyone around me was paying enough attention to the fact that death was around every corner the things that helped me medication none of the other stuff would have worked without that hydration super important for me like gallon day was what needed getting rid of caffeine learning meditation hypnosis breathing things that did not help reassurances that everything is fine there is nothing to worry about you re not going to die therapy am actually therapist and know that therapy is very important in most treatment plans for me it did work because really just thought that my therapist was not thinking logically and was just reassuring me without full knowledge of the situation breastfeeding in most cases women can and should continue to breastfeed through mental illness if they desire to do so but had dysphoric milk ejection reflex and it was exacerbating maybe even causing my anxiety due to an inappropriate drop in dopamine levels triggered by oxytocin with each letdown response may also be taking lot less risks like driving less aggressively paying attention to which routes take being more aware if someone kind of sketchy is near me because worry lot more about those two things too staying out of those situations is the best way to avoid them thank you for mentioning mer it is real but no one ever talks about it because breastfeeding is *supposed to be* this magical blissful bonding experience and yet for some women the very act of nursing gives them horrible anxiety depression or worse it also helps to keep in mind that mothers have been going though this for very very long time without drugs available to them maybe they had other things to worry about maybe they had the comfort of family not condoning the fact did seek medical help or the help of drugs felt like knew my body better than anyone else it also was situation where there were doctors or medications available to me have confidence in yourself and know things will feel little better every day some days leap forward some days step back but always getting better thanks incredible you are hard worker thank you for sharing oh definitely good to know thanks good for you thanks for the info like your ideas about how to over come it you re right you re not going to die is not helpful lol no prob good luck with everything she is haha very true
